text: hey guys it's angel in today's tip TV
I'm going to show you my favorite way to
make oatmeal which is in a rice cooker
now this is my favorite way to make
oatmeal because you can make steel-cut
oats and even extra thick rolled oats
without slaving away at the stove and
the rice cooker makes it perfectly so
for this recipe all you'll need are some
steel coats or some extra thick rolled
oats now folk here but I am going to
make some extra thick rolled oats
because I already have this open now in
order to make oatmeal on your rice
cooker you will need a rice cooker that
has a porridge mode on it and for those
of you who don't know what porridges or
just just another word for congee which
is think of it like rice oatmeal oatmeal
but rice so it's really good
luckily most rice cookers today have a
porridge boat on it so if you have a
newer rice cooker then you will likely
have this feature on it so start by
adding 1 cup of your favorite oatmeal oh
and just a quick note when I say 1 cup
I'm actually using 1 cup which is a
measuring cup for my rice cooker so it's
a rice cooker measuring cup and it's
actually
160 milliliters but that's okay you can
use whatever cup you want but you'll
want to do it in a 1 to 3 ratio so 1 cup
of oatmeal 2 3 quarts of water ok and
finally totally optional but I really
like adding a couple pinches of cinnamon
to give it a nice aroma and maybe one
more you can also add a pinch of salt if
you like but I feel like we already get
so much sodium from our everyday eating
that it's not necessary
so go ahead cover that up put that on
forage mode and press Start
so my rice cooker actually sings a song
which is kind of cool when you press it
and then I think it actually seems a
song when it's done too which is kind of
fun now depending on how much oatmeal
you're cooking and what type of rice
cooker you have it could take anywhere
between 45 minutes to an hour and a half
to cook now it's really nice is most
rice cookers these days have a timer
mode so let's say the night before you
are going to beg you can go ahead and
just put all the oatmeal the water the
cinnamon in there and set it for a delay
timer to let's say you want to get up at
7 or 6 a.m. and have fresh oatmeal when
you wake up the rice cooker will have
everything cooked by 6 o'clock a.m. and
your house will smell amazing or your
kitchen will smell baking because there
will be that beautiful cinnamon smell of
the oatmeal and you'll have perfectly
made oatmeal good morning so as you can
see making oatmeal and your rice cooker
is super quick and easy I hope you guys
enjoy today's kitchen tip don't forget
to Like and subscribe to my channel
angel Long's kitchen and post in the
comments below and let me know how you
guys
see your oatmeal so with that I will see
you guys in my next video bye
